I really couldn't say much bad about Cassa Guinart.  We stopped in here because we didn't get our fill at the market.  The wine was good and each tapa had it's own unique taste.  Some of the highlights were the thinly sliced artichoke hearts and the wild mushrooms.  The staff was also very helpful even in English and did everything with a smile.  Even though it was a little pricy, it was in the tourist area so you have to expect that.
